title: Mikel Arteta - Wikipedia
snippet: Mikel Arteta Amatriain (born 26 March 1982) is a Spanish professional football manager and former player who is the manager of Premier League club Arsenal. He is widely regarded as one of the best managers in the world. Arteta began his senior club career at Barcelona in 1999, but limited playing ...

title: Arsenal Manager Information | Arsenal Insider
snippet: Arsenal appointed Mikel Arteta as the club’s latest manager in December 2019 with the title of head coach. He returned to the club to replace Unai Emery at the Emirates Stadium helm.

title: Arsenal F.C. - Wikipedia
snippet: Herbert Chapman won the club its first silverware, and his legacy enabled a trophy-laden period in the 1930s. title: List of Arsenal F.C. managers - Wikipedia
snippet: The most successful person to manage Arsenal is Arsène Wenger, who won three Premier League titles, seven FA Cups and seven Community Shields between 1996 and 2018. Wenger is the club's longest-serving manager; he surpassed George Allison's ...
